summary: This is the 3rd time this happened to me.  The first time I was driving around 55 and the truck started to shake so bad I could not actually hold onto the steering wheel, and I made it to the side of the road.  I thought was a flat tire and I pulled over to find nothing wrong. The second was bad as it shook so violently, I was unable to make it to the side of the road, so I hit the brakes in the middle of traffic to stop. This 3rd time I happen to be traveling 65 mph on the interstate in PA and hit a small bump and all of the sudden the truck felt like it was bouncing off of the road.  I hit the brakes to slow down and drove to the side and into a field.   I purchased tie rods and actually the entire front suspension.  This was the worst shaking I have ever felt in 45 years of driving.  This is going to get me killed when this happens on the road.  Please help.   [XXX]  INFORMATION Redacted PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).
Fuel pump failed with no warning. Best One of Indy confirmed and replaced. It was parked and would not start.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE EXHAUST SYSTEM REGENERATION REQUIRED NOW WARNING LIGHT WAS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO A LOCAL DEALER. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS INFORMED OF THE FAILURE AND INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THE VIN WAS NOT UNDER RECALL. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 43,000.

I RECEIVED A VE5 LATE LIFE EMISSION PERFORMANCE DEGRADATION RECALL IN JANUARY 2021.  I HAD THE RECALL PERFORMED ON 1.27/2021 AT RAZZARI DODGE, MERCED.  THEY INSTALLED A NEW CAT CONVERTER AND EXHAUST MANIFOLD.  WHEN I GOT MY TRUCK BACK, I HAD AN CEL ERROR CODE P2271 O2 SENSOR.  I HAD TO PAY $707.74 AND $978.98 TO GET THE TRUCK RUNNING.  I HAD NO PREVIOUS CEL.  I THINK THEY BROKE THE WIRING HARNESS OR O2 SENSORS WHEN THEY PERFORMED THE RECALL.  .  I THINK THE VE5 RECALL REPAIR, SHOULD MAKE THE ENTIRE EMISSIONS SYSTEM FUNCTION, INCLUDING THE CONTROL ELECTRONICS.

I TOOK IT TO THE DODGE DEALER FOR A RECALL NOTICE I RECEIVED, THE RECALL WAS FOR THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER AND THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD TO BE REPLACED. THE WORK WAS COMPLETED, I TOOK THE TRUCK HOME AND ASSUMED THINGS WERE FINE. IN JANUARY OF THIS YEAR I WENT UNDER THE TRUCK TO SEE ABOUT A OIL LEAK I WAS HAVING A PROBLEM WITH, I NOTICED THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER WAS DIRTY LOOKING AND HAD SCRATCHES ON IT. IT HAD A BROWNISH KIND OF LIGHT FILM ON IT. I DID NOT LOOK LIKE A NEW ONE. I TOOK IT TO ANOTHER REPAIR SHOP FOR THEIR OPINION. THEY COULDN'T BE SURE BUT THEY SAID IT LOOKS LIKE AN OLD ONE ALSO, THEY INSPECTED THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD AND TOLD ME IT HAS RUST STAINS ON IT AND DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A NEW ONE. I AM IN NEED OF SOMEONE TO REFER ME TO AN EXPERT SO WE CAN DETERMINE IF WEATHER OR NOT THE DEALER ACTUALLY REPLACED THE THE PARTS OR NOT. CAN YOU HELP PLEASE.

THE AIR BAG LIGHT BEGAN FLASHING OFF AND ON INTERMITTENTLY WHILE DRIVING. AFTER A FEW WEEKS, THE LIGHT JUST STAYED ON AND REMAINS ON.  WHEN MY TRUCK WAS IN FOR SERVICE, I WAS INFORMED THE OCR MODULE HAD FAILED AND WAS QUOTED APPROXIMATELY $750 TO REPAIR. SEEMS TO ME THIS IS A NON-SERVICEABLE SAFETY COMPONENT THAT HAS FAILED. I HOPE THIS SYSTEM FAILURE IS A RECALL ISSUE.

I HAVE A 2010 DODGE RAM 2500 ST. THE VEHICLE IGNITION WON'T ALLOW THE VEHICLE TO START SOME TIMES. ALSO WHEN DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD, THE TRUCK CUTS OFF AND I HAVE TO RESTART IT IN THE MIDDLE OF TRAFFIC. IVE HAD TO ROLL TO THE SIE OF THE ROAD ON MUTIPLE OCCASSIONS UNTIL I CAN GET IT RESTARTED, LUCKILY I HAVENT HAD AN ACCIDENT YET. I GOOGLED THE ISSUE AND IT SEEMS TO BE A COMMON PROBLEM WITH THE WIN MODULE ON THE DODGE VEHICLES YET THERE HASNT BEEN A RECALL INITIATED. IT'S TURNING INTO A DAILY OCCURRACE WITH THIS.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT POWER STEERING PUMP CAP DID NOT VENT PROPERLY AND AS THE CONTACT ATTEMPTED TO CHECK THE STEERING FLUID, NOT REALIZING THAT THE POWER STEERING FLUID WAS UNDER PRESSURE, THE FLUID EXPLODED AND BURNED THE CONTACT'S RIGHT HAND AND NECK. THE BURNS WERE SECOND DEGREE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT IF HE DID NOT HAVE SUNGLASSES ON, HE WOULD HAVE SUSTAINED MORE SEVERE INJURIES. THE CONTACT CALLED THE LA FONTAINE CHRYSLER DEALER, LOCATED IN SALINE, MICHIGAN AT: 248-887-4747 AND WAS TOLD THAT THE VIN WAS NOT PART OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 10V616000 (STEERING). THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 190,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 50 MPH, THE VEHICLE RODE OVER A BUMP IN THE ROADWAY AND EXPERIENCED THE DEATH WOBBLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO SEVERAL INDEPENDENT MECHANICS DUE TO THE FAILURE TO BE DIAGNOSED AND REPAIRED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE STEERING TRACK BAR, THE STEERING COLUMN STABILIZER, INNER AND OUTER TIE RODS, STEERING DAMPENER, BALL JOINTS AND WHEEL BEARINGS WERE REPLACED HOWEVER, THE FAILURE RECURRED. A DEALER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT CONTACTED AND INFORMED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 60,000. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

ON THE EVENING OF MAY 1ST, 2020, I PULLED MY 2010 DODGE RAM 2500 TRX 4WD INTO MY SONS? DRIVEWAY AND DROPPED OFF MY GRANDDAUGHTER. I WENT TO BACK OUT OF THE DRIVEWAY TURNING MY WHEEL TO THE RIGHT AS I BACKED OUT I HEARD WHAT SOUNDED LIKE I RAN OVER A LARGE ROCK, AS I PULLED FORWARD I TURNED MY WHEEL TO THE LEFT AND PROCEEDED FORWARD ONLY TO HAVE THE TRUCK GO RIGHT BACK IN THE YARD WHERE I HAD JUST PULLED OUT. I REALIZED THAT THERE WAS AN ISSUE WITH THE STEERING. I CLIMBED UNDER THE TRUCK TO DISCOVER THAT THE TIE ROD HAD SHEARED OFF AT THE PITMAN ARM. THIS CAUSED A COMPLETE LOSS OF STEERING. I HAD A FRONT-END ALIGNMENT ABOUT 2 YEARS AGO WITH NO ISSUES. PRIOR TO THAT I HAD A RECALL ISSUE WITH THE DRAG LINK ABOUT 3 OR 4 YEARS AGO WITH NO OTHER KNOWN ISSUES. I DO NOT DRIVE THE TRUCK OFF ROAD JUST ON PAVED ROADS. THE PARTS ARE THE FACTORY SEALED TIE ROD WITH NO GREASE FITTING. I HAVE BEEN REPAIRING VEHICLES FOR OVER 40. I HAVE NEVER SEEN THIS TYPE OF FAILURE. THE NORMAL FAILURE MODE FOR THIS PART SHOULD HAVE BEEN LOTS OF SLACK IN THE JOINT FROM LOSS OF GREASE. THIS FAILURE MODE IS NOT ACCEPTABLE! IF I HAD BEEN TRAVELING AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS AND THIS PART HAD BROKEN I WOULD HAVE HAD TOTAL LOSS OF STEERING AND YOU KNOW AS WELL AS I DO WHEN YOU HIT YOUR BRAKES THE VEHICLE TENDS TO PULL TO THE RIGHT DUE TO THE SLOPE OF THE ROAD WHICH IS DESIGNED FOR WATER RUNOFF. THIS COULD HAVE RESULTED IN A CATASTROPHIC CRASH RESULTING IN SERIOUS INJURY OR DEATH. THIS IS SOMETHING THAT NEEDS TO BE ADDRESS IMMEDIATELY BEFORE SOMEONE DIES!  *TR
VEHICLE CONSTANTLY GETTING EXHAUST FUMES INTO CAB OF TRUCK.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNED A 2010 RAM 2500. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 60 MPH, SMOKE SUDDENLY APPEARED UNDER THE HOOD. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 325,725.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE TRANSMISSION MALFUNCTIONED AND FRACTURED WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH. THE CONTACT WAS ABLE TO COAST THE VEHICLE TO THE SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED BACK TO THE CONTACT'S HOUSE. RON LEWIS CHRYSLER DODGE JEEP RAM WAYNESBURG (1625 E HIGH ST, WAYNESBURG, PA 15370) WAS CONTACTED AND INFORMED THE CONTACT TO BRING THE VEHICLE IN FOR AN INITIAL DIAGNOSTIC AT THE COST OF $121. ORIGINAL TIPM FAILED AT 151000 MILES CAUSING FRONT TURNING SIGNALS TO MALFUNCTION. THE TIPM CONTROLS ALL ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS AND SENSORS THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE VEHICLE INCLUDING FUEL PUMPS AND AIR BAGS. I WAS DRIVING MY VEHICLE ON A CITY STREET WHEN AN ALARM DISPLAYED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL NOTING A FRONT RIGHT TURN SIGNAL LAMP NEEDS REPLACEMENT. I REPLACED THE BULB PER REPLACEMENT BULB NUMBER SPECIFIED IN THE OWNERS MANUAL. ALSO, REPLACED THE TURN SIGNAL MULTI SWITCH WHICH BOTH ITEMS DID NOT RESOLVE THE ISSUE. MADE THE DECISION TO HAVE A CERTIFIED MECHANIC TO DIAGNOSE THE PROBLEM.

I WAS ABOUT TO GO ON A ELK HUNTING TRIP IN WYOMING AND MY MODE SELECTOR DOOR GOT STUCK BLOWING ONLY ON THE FLOOR. MY WINDOWS WOULDNT DEFROST BECAUSE THERE WAS NO HOT AIR WOULD COME OUT OF DEFROST VENTS. LUCKILY IM A DIESEL TECHNICIAN BY TRADE AND HAVE THE ABILITY TO REPAIR PROBLEM. I REPLACED MODE DOOR AND PROBLEM WAS RESOLVED. AFTER READING ONLINE I FOUND OUT THAT THIS IS A VERRY COMMON PROBLEM.

THE VEHICLE WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 17V821000 (POWER TRAIN). THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED AND NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. I DROVE THE TRUCK ABOUT 20MILES HOME, SHUT THE TRUCK OFF AND UNLOADED BOTH OF MY SLEEPING CHILDREN. BY THE TIME I GOT BACK TO THE TRUCK TO UNLOAD OUR STUFF MY WHOLE GARAGE WAS FILLED WITH SMOKE. I QUICKLY BACKED THE TRUCK OUT OF THE GARAGE AND CALLED 911 BECAUSE IT WAS CONTINUING TO SMOKE HEAVILY. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT CAME POPPED THE HOOD AND PUT OUT THE FIRE. THEY UNHOOKED BOTH BATTERIES AND THEY COULD SHOW ME WHAT WAS ON FIRE THE ALTERNATOR AND WIRES SURROUNDING OUTSIDE OF IT. TOLD ME NOT TO DRIVE IT ANYWHERE UNTIL A MECHANIC CAN COME. IVE ASKED THE FIRE DEPARTMENT FOR THE REPORT BUT THEY HAVEN'T SENT IT OVER YET.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 DODGE RAM 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 17V821000 (POWER TRAIN) EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR REPAIR. THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTIFICATION IN DECEMBER OF 2017 BUT HAD NOT YET RECEIVED A LETTER OF CONFIRMATION THAT THE PARTS WERE AVAILABLE OR AN EXPECTED AVAILABLE DATE. THE DEALER AND MANUFACTURER WERE NOT CONTACTED. THE CONTACT EXPERIENCED A TRANSMISSION FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN. PARTS DISTRIBUTION DISCONNECT. *TT    THE CONSUMER STATED THE TRANSMISSION WAS REPAIRED AT THE TUNE OF $6,000. *TR

TL*  THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. AFTER THE CONTACT'S HUSBAND PLACED THE VEHICLE IN PARK AND EXITED THE VEHICLE, IT PROCEEDED TO ROLL AND RAN HIM OVER. THE CONTACT'S HUSBAND SUFFERED A CONTUSION ON THE LEFT KNEE, LACERATIONS ON THE LEFT LEG, AND OTHER MINOR INJURIES. MEDICAL ATTENTION WAS RECEIVED. THE DEALER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSIS OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED AND INFORMED THE CONTACT TO CALL NHTSA. THE CONTACT RECENTLY RECEIVED A RECALL LETTER FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 17V821000 (POWER TRAIN). THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 219,000. PARTS DISTRIBUTION DISCONNECT.

THE IGNITION SWITCH IS FAULTY    ( WIRELESS IGNITION NODE )  THE TRUCK CAN TURN OFF COMPLETELY IN TRAFFIC UNEXPECTEDLY     ON THREE SEPARATE CVASIONS IN TRAFFIC ON PUBLIC ROADS WHILE DRIVING THE TRUCK SPONTANEOUSLY TURNED OFF AND SHUT DOWN..    YOU HAVE TO PLACE IN PARK AND RESTART THE TRUCK      THIS IS VERY DANGEROUS AND CAN CAUSE A CRASH

I HAVE RECENTLY EXPERIENCED "THE DEATH WOBBLE" IN MY TRUCK. (2010 DODGE RAM 2500) I WAS TRAVELING ON THE HIGHWAY AT APPROXIMATELY 75 MILES PER HOUR, WHEN I HIT A SMALL BUMP AND MY TRUCK BEGAN SHAKING VIOLENTLY AND UNCONTROLLABLY ON THE FRONT END. APPLYING MY BREAKS DID NOT HELP. ALL I COULD DO IS HOLD ON FOR THE RIDE UNTIL I SLOWED DOWN TO APPROXIMATELY 35 MILES PER HOUR. I PULLED OVER AND EXAMINED MY TRUCK THINKING THAT SOMETHING WAS SEVERELY DAMAGED DUE TO THE EXTREME NATURE OF THE INCIDENT AND COULD NOT FIND ANY DAMAGES. I SLOWLY DROVE HOME AFRAID OF IT HAPPENING AGAIN. I DID NOT KNOW WHAT THE VIOLENT SHAKING IN MY TRUCK WAS CALLED UNTIL I RESEARCHED THIS SCARY EXPERIENCE. UPON CONDUCTING MY RESEARCH, I LEARNED THAT THIS IS A COMMON PROBLEM WITH MY YEAR, MAKE AND MODEL OF VEHICLE. I HAVE ALREADY TAKEN IT IN FOR A COUPLE OF RECALL ITEMS REGARDING STEERING ISSUES. I AM AFRAID THEY MAY HAVE REPLACED ANY RECALL ITEMS WITH FAULTY PARTS.
WHILE DRIVING HIT A BUMP KEY FALLS OUT OR TRUCK SHUTS OFF WITH KEY STILL IN
WIPER MOTOR MOUNT WELDS BREAK.
TRUCK KEEP SHUTTING IT SELF OFF AND WHILE DRIVING.

EXHAUST MANIFOLD LEAK ON 2010 DODGE RAM- THIS CAN DAMAGE PLASTIC COMPONENTS IN THE ENGINE BAY. IT CAN ALSO BECOME A HEALTH HAZARD, AS THE EXHAUST FUMES CAN ENTER THE CAR'S CABIN.   UPON DOING RESEARCH MANY DODGE OWNERS HAVE HAD THIS SAME LEAK AND DODGE HAS NOT ISSUED A RECALL.  MOST VEHICLES ONLY HAVE AROUND 50,000 MILES WHEN THE MANIFOLDS BREAK AND THE EXHAUST BEGINS TO LEAK.
EXHAUST SYSTEM GETS SO HOT THE BED LINER MELTED.

WHILE DRIVING AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS THE TRUCK WILL COMPLETELY SHUT DOWN, NO POWER STEERING, BRAKES, LIGHTS IT JUST GOES DEAD. NO WARNING LIGHTS OR CODES THROWN. THIS HAS HAPPENED ABOUT 10 TIMES NOW. VERY DANGEROUS WHEN IT HAPPENS AT NIGHT.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. THE CONTACT SMELLED MOLD INSIDE THE VEHICLE AND THE HEADLINER AND STORAGE UNDERNEATH THE BACK SEAT WERE RETAINING WATER. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE CAB WAS LEAKING DUE TO A FAULTY SEALING ON THE REAR WINDOW. THE VEHICLE WAS TEMPORARILY REPAIRED AND THE DEALER DIAGNOSED THAT THE SEAL ON THE REAR WINDOW NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE DID NOT RECEIVE A PERMANENT REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND DIRECTED THE CONTACT TO NHTSA. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 98,000.   UPDATED 01/06/17*LJ   THE CONSUMER STATED REAR WINDOW SEAL LEAKING.  UPDATED 7/5/18*JB   *TR

WHEN FIRST TAKING OFF YOU PUT YOUR FOOT ON THE GAS PEDAL AND IT GOES ALL THE WAY TO THE FLOOR AND DOESN'T GO. IT'S LIKE IT'S STUCK, NO POWER. FINALLY WILL GO AND THEN KEEPS REPEATING, JERKING. ONCE DRIVING FOR AWHILE IT WON'T DO IT AGAIN.

WHEN PULLING OUT ONTO A 5 LANE ROAD THE VEHICLE SHUT OFF, I WAS ABLE TO RESTART AND CONTINUE.  THEN WHEN TURNING OFF A 5 LANE ROAD THE VEHICLE SHUT OFF, I WAS ABLE TO RESTART AND CONTINUE.  ON THE EXPRESSWAY AT 70 MPH TOWING A CAR TRAILER THE VEHICLE SHUT OFF.  I WAS IN THE RIGHT LANE AND WAS ABLE TO PULL OFF AND RESTART TO CONTINUE. TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH, THE ENGINE STALLED AND THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT ILLUMINATED. THE FAILURE WAS PERSISTENT. THE VEHICLE WAS ABLE TO RESTART. TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 RAM 2500. THE CONTACT HEARD A KNOCKING SOUND BEHIND THE DASHBOARD OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE PLASTIC GEAR ACTUATOR WAS FAULTY AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. AS A RESULT, NONE OF THE HVAC FUNCTIONS WERE OPERATIONAL. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED, BUT DID NOT ASSIST DUE TO THE VEHICLE NOT BEING INCLUDED IN THE MANUFACTURER'S RECALL. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 69,500.

I HAVE HAD THIS 2010 DODGE RAM 2500 HD CREWCAB 4X4 FOR 3 YEARS.  I BOUGHT IT USED AT 74000.  SO FAR I HAVE HAD 3 ACTUATORS, TIE ROD, 3 DIFFERENTIAL SEALS, 1 TRANSMISSION SEAL, 1 REAREND SEAL, FULL HVAC CONTROL AND DUCT WORK WITH 2 HEATER CORES, 2 FRONT U-JOINT, AND NOW ALL THE BEARINGS IN THE FRONT DIFFERENTIAL.  AND EXTREME AMOUNT OF TIME, MONEY, AND TROUBLE OF NOT HAVING MY TRUCK INVESTED IN THIS.  I NEED TO KNOW HOW MAY OTHER OF THIS MODEL OF TRUCK HAS BEEN HAVING THIS TROUBLE.  99% HWY MILES, ONLY ABOUT 5% TOWING OR HAULING, NO OFF ROADING, VERY LITTLE LONG DISTANCE DRIVING. I HAVE AN EXTENDED WARRANTY FOR DRIVE TRAIN.  IS YOUR DEFINITION THE STANDARD TERM FOR DRIVETRAIN?

HVAC SYSTEM TROUBLE. VERY LITTLE HEAT AND AIRFLOW ON DRIVERS SIDE OF VEHICLE.  AC IS FINE.  PASSENGER SIDE HAS FULL AIRFLOW AND HEAT.  ACTUATORS HAVE BEEN CHANGED AND TESTED.  DEALERSHIPS HAVE CHANGED HEATER CORE, BUT TROUBLE PERSISTS.  NEW DEALER WANTS TO CHANGE HEATER CORE.  ON GOING ISSUE.  I AM NOT THE ONLY ONE HAVING THIS TROUBLE.  NUMEROUS REPORTS OF BLEND DOOR PROBLEMS BUT SERVICE WILL NOT DIAGNOSE OR FIX.  TROUBLE HAS BEEN ON GOING TO 3 YEARS.  NEED RESOLUTION.  STARTED WHEN ACTUATORS WERE CHANGED ON RECALL.  DO NOT REMEMBER EXACT DATE.

I HAVE READ SOMEWHERE ELSE HTTP://WWW.DODGETALK.COM/FORUMS/SHOWTHREAD.PHP?T=364235) THAT OTHER PEOPLE HAVE BEEN HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM I HAVE HAD. MY HEATED MIRRORS ARE STARTING TO BURN WHEN I USE THE HEATED MIRROR FUNCTION TO GET RID OF THE CONDENSATION. I AM NOT SURE IF THERE IS A THERMAL REGULATOR SWITCH, OR A SAFETY THAT HAS BEEN ACTING UP, BUT THE HEAT FROM THE COIL ON THE BACK OF THE MIRROR IS STARTING TO DISCOLOR THE FACE OF THE MIRROR. LUCKILY THERE WAS NO TRAFFIC NEXT TO ME AND NO ONE WAS INJURED. ON THE DATE OF THE INCIDENT, I WAS TOLD BY THE SERVICE PERSONNEL THAT THEY ARE ALLOWED ON A SMALL NUMBER OF PARTS AND THAT THEY CANNOT GET ADDITIONAL PARTS UNTIL THEY SUBMIT PROOF OF INSTALLING THE PREVIOUSLY SENT PARTS.  YET THIS DEALERSHIP HAD PARTS THAT THEY HAD BEEN HOLDING FOR SEVERAL WEEKS FOR A CUSTOMER WHO HAD NOT RESPONDED TO THE NOTICE THEIR PARTS WERE IN. IT DOESN'T APPEAR THAT CHRYSLER TRULY VALUES THE SAFETY OF THEIR CUSTOMERS.  *TR

DRIVING UP COUNTRY ROAD AT 45 MPH IN MY DODGE RAM 2500 DIESEL, WITH ONLY 40K MILES ON IT.  ALL OF A SUDDEN, DEATH WOBBLE HITS.  NO ABILITY TO STEER AND NO BRAKES.  RIGHT WHEEL GETS JAMMED INTO FRAME OF TRUCK AT 45MPH AND CAN'T SPIN SO VIOLENT AND UNCONTROLLABLE SHAKING.  EVIDENCED BY TIRE MARKS ON THE FRAME OF MY TRUCK.  HAVE PHOTOS.  SENDS ME UP THE SIDE OF THE ROAD, AND ALMOST FLIPS THE TRUCK UPSIDE DOWN. MANAGED TO GET TRUCK UNDER CONTROL, BY SLAMMING ON MY BRAKES,  IN ONCOMING TRAFFIC, MY DOG HITS THE WINDSHIELD. POLICE OFFICER WAS RIGHT BEHIND ME AND WITNESSED THE ENTIRE EVENT, TOLD ME I WAS LUCKY TO BE ALIVE.  WHEN I CALLED DODGE THEY DENIED EVERYTHING.  LOOKED UP INTERNET AND FOUND "DEATH WOBBLE" WHICH IS EXACTLY WHAT TRANSPIRED WITH THE TRUCK.  FORTUNATELY AT THE TIME I WAS NOT HAULING MY HORSE TRAILER OR ALL WOULD HAVE BEEN DEAD.   DAMAGES TO DATE SO FAR IS 8K, INCLUDING FRAME, FRONT BUMPER, FRONT SUSPENSION, STEERING, FRONT AXLE ASSEMBLY.  THIS IS ABSOLUTELY OUTRAGEOUS FOR A TRUCK THAT ONLY HAS 40K MILES.  *TR

UPON PURCHASING THIS USED PICKUP I PERFORMED AN INSPECTION OF THE UNDER CARRIAGE I NOTICED THAT THE OIL PAN HAD A PRETTY SIGNIFICANT DENT IN IT. IT WAS OBVIOUSLY CAUSED BY A SKID PLATE THAT WAS MOUNTED ON THE FRONT AXLE OF THIS TRUCK FROM THE FACTORY. I WENT ONLINE AND FOUND MANY OWNER OF THIS MODEL HAD THE SAME ISSUE. ONE PERSON WAS SUCCESSFUL IN GETTING A DEALERSHIP TO REMOVE THE SKID PLATE AND REPLACE THE OIL PAN. THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT SAID THAT THE SKID PLATE WAS ONLY MEANT TO BE PUT ON THE GASOLINE MODELS NOT THE DIESEL MODELS. THIS IS DUE TO NOT HAVING ENOUGH CLEARANCE. THIS CAN CAUSE A HOLE IN THE OIL PAN WHICH CAN EASILY LEAD TO AN EXPENSIVE BUT NEEDLESS ENGINE FAILURE. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE ON A TRUCK THAT COST $50000, DODGE SHOULD PERFORM THESE REPAIRS AND SKID PLATE REMOVAL FOR THESE MODELS FOR NO COST.  *TR

TRAVELING 60 MPH ON A TWO LANE COUNTY ROAD IN A RURAL AREA, SPEED LIMIT 55MPH.  DROVE OVER A SLIGHT BUMP IN THE ROAD THAT WAS OVER A SMALL CREEK WHEN THE STEERING WHEEL SUDDENLY AND VIOLENTLY STARTED TO WOBBLE BACK AND FORTH AND THE VEHICLE STARTED TO SHAKE VIOLENTLY AS WELL.  THE VEHICLE WAS UNCONTROLLABLE AND STARTED TO FORCE ME OFF THE ROAD TOWARD A WOODED AREA.LUCKILY I WAS ABLE TO SLOW DOWN ENOUGH FOR THE "DEATH WOBBLE" TO SUBSIDE ENOUGH FOR ME TO REGAIN CONTROL.  I WAS ON MY WAY TO PERFORM A CHORE AND HAD TO RETURN FROM THIS CHORE ON THE SAME ROAD.  THE EXACT SAME THING HAPPENED ON THE RETURN TRIP.  VIOLENT SHAKING OF THE STEERING WHEEL AND VEHICLE AND TOTAL LOSS OF CONTROL.    THE SAME THING HAPPENED ABOUT TWO MONTHS AGO ON AN INTERSTATE HIGHWAY.  THE ROAD SURFACE WAS POORLY MAINTAINED AND THE "DEATH WOBBLE" OCCURRED WHEN I DROVE OVER AN IMPERFECTION ON THE ROAD SURFACE.  LUCKILY NO OTHER VEHICLES WERE NEXT TO ME OR AN ACCIDENT SURELY WOULD HAVE OCCURRED.  THIS FIRST EVENT I THOUGHT WAS JUST BY CHANCE, BUT AFTER THE LAST EVENT HAPPENING TWICE ON THE SAME DAY HAS ME CONVINCED THAT THERE IS A FLAW IN THE STEERING AND/OR SUSPENSION.    I WENT TO THE DEALER WHERE I BOUGHT THE TRUCK AFTER DOING A WEB SEARCH ON PROBLEMS WITH THIS VEHICLE (MANY COMPLAINTS POSTED DETAILING EXACTLY WHAT HAD OCCURRED WITH ME) AND TOLD THE SERVICE REP WHAT HAD HAPPENED AND SHE SAID SHE HAD HEARD NO SUCH COMPLAINTS FROM OTHERS.  THE ROADS IN MY COUNTY ARE VERY RURAL AND WELL MAINTAINED.  NO PROBLEMS ON WELL MAINTAINED ROADS, HOWEVER, ON POORLY MAINTAINED ROADS OR OVER EXPANSION JOINTS OR POTHOLES GOING 60 MPH WILL THROW THIS VEHICLE INTO A "DEATH WOBBLE" AS IT HAS BEEN CALLED.  *TR

WAS DRIVING UNDER CRUISE CONTROL AT 75MPH ON I95 NORTH IN THE MIDDLE LANE, AND NOTICED MY TRUCK STARTED SLOWING DOWN AND ENGINE HAD STALLED.  POWER STEERING AND POWER BRAKES WENT OUT AND THERE WAS TRAFFIC COMING UP BEHIND ME IN ALL THREE LANES, SO I HAD DIFFICULTY STEERING THE TRUCK OFF TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.   ALL ELECTRONICS REMAINED ON, KEY WAS STILL IN ON POSITION, AND THERE WERE NO STATUS INDICATORS ANYWHERE ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL OR EVIC TO INDICATE THERE WAS A PROBLEM.  THE FUEL GAUGE WAS STILL OVER HALF FULL.  ONCE THE TRUCK CAME TO A STOP, I PUT IT BACK IN PARK AND TURNED THE KEY OFF.  I WAS THEN ABLE TO START THE TRUCK BACK UP AND CONTINUE DRIVING THE REST OF THE WAY HOME WITHOUT ANOTHER INCIDENT.    I TOOK THE TRUCK INTO THE DEALER THE NEXT DAY AND THEY WERE UNABLE TO FIND ANY FAULT CODES FROM THE ECU.   BECAUSE THERE WERE NO FAULT CODES FOUND, THE DEALER WAS UNABLE OR UNWILLING TO PERFORM ANY REPAIRS TO PREVENT THIS DANGEROUS CONDITION FROM RE-OCCURRING.  SO, I'VE DONE SOME RESEARCH OF MY OWN ON THIS CONDITION AND FOUND THAT CHRYSLER HAS HAD IDENTICAL PROBLEMS IN OTHER VEHICLE MODELS FOR WHICH THEY ISSUED A RECALL (RE: NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 11V139000).  IT SEEMS THIS PROBLEM IS CAUSED BY A LOSS OF COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE KEY FOB AND THE WIRELESS IGNITION NODE (WIN).  THIS WIRELESS CONNECTION IS REQUIRED TO START THE VEHICLE, BUT FOR A GLITCH IN THE WIRELESS CONNECTION TO RESULT IN A COMPLETE ENGINE SHUTDOWN WHILE TRAVELING AT HIGH SPEED IS A HUGE SAFETY ISSUE.  I AM NOW AFRAID TO DRIVE MY TRUCK ON THE HIGHWAY UNLESS I STAY IN THE RIGHT HAND LANE.  *TR

THE DEALER PERFORMED RECALL K33 SERVICE TODAY. BEFORE SERVICE, THE BRAKE LIGHTS STAYED ILLUMINATED ABOUT 1 SECOND AFTER THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS RELEASED. AFTER SERVICE, THE BRAKE LIGHTS STILL STAYED ILLUMINATED ABOUT 1 SECOND AFTER THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS RELEASED. THE PS RESERVOIR CAP WAS REPLACED, BUT THIS DOES NOT SOLVE THE PROBLEM.  THE BRAKE SAFETY INTERLOCK FOR THE SHIFT LEVER ALSO STAYS DISENGAGED FOR THE SAME 1 SECOND WHEN THE SHIFT LEVER IS IN "PARK". HOWEVER, MY CONCERN HAS BEEN AND STILL IS THAT MY TRAILER BRAKES ALSO REMAIN ENGAGED FOR THE SAME 1 SECOND INTERVAL AFTER THE BRAKE PEDAL IS RELEASED. THIS IS MOST NOTICEABLE WHEN STOPPED AT A LIGHT. I HAVE TO RELEASE THE BRAKE PEDAL, WAIT ABOUT 1 SECOND FOR THE TRAILER BRAKES TO RELEASE, THEN BEGIN TO ACCELERATE. THIS PUTS UNNECESSARY STRAIN ON MY TRAILER BRAKES, AND IS A CONCERN IN WET OR SNOWY CONDITIONS WHEN THE VEHICLE IS MOVING. THE TRAILER BRAKE CONTROL WORKS PROPERLY, AND SINCE THE TRAILER BRAKES DISENGAGE AND THE TRUCK BRAKE LIGHTS TURN OFF AT THE SAME TIME, THIS IS OBVIOUSLY THE SAME PROBLEM, AND IS NOT SOLVED BY REPLACING THE POWER STEERING RESERVOIR CAP.  *TR
